required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Efficacy of Ranibizumab in Different Regimens in Patients With Diabetic Macula Edema
clinical_study.official_title: A 12-months, Randomized, VA-assessor Blinded, Multicenter, Controlled Phase IV Trial to Investigate Noninferiority of Two Treatment Algorithms (Discretion of the Investigator vs. Pro re Nata) of 0.5 mg Ranibizumab in Patients With Visual Impairment Due to Diabetic Macula Edema

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study was to demonstrate that the change of best corrected visual acuity (BCVA) was comparable in patients treated with ranibizumab at the discretion of the investigator vs. treatment according to a standard of care scheme (pro re nata, as needed).

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Average Change From Baseline in Best Corrected Visual Acuity (BCVA) of the Study Eye From Month 1 to Study Treatment Completion (Month 12)
primary_outcome.description: BCVA was assessed as letters read using Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study (ETDRS) charts. The mean average change from baseline was defined as the difference between the average level of BCVA (ETDRS letters) over all post-baseline assessments from Month 1 to Month 12. A positive change represents an improvement in visual acuity

secondary_outcome.description: Mean number of visits during the study
mean number of injections in the study eye during the study

A treatment-free interval is the interval between the first NO treatment given when the reason for NO treatment given is one of the three stability criteria and the first subsequent YES treatment given after that.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change in Central Subfield Retinal Thickness (CSRT)
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluated by central reading center assessing OCT images

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change of Foveal Center Point Thickness
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluated by central reading center assessing OCT images

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Change in Diabetic Retinopathy Study (DRS) Retinopathy Scale
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluated by central reading center scoring fundus photography

arm_group.description: ranibizumab 0.5 mg, after initial monthly treatment until maximum BCVA and no signs or no further change of disease activity, the investigator treated patients at their own discretion. There were no strict recommendations for retreatment or scheduling of upcoming visits.

ranibizumab 0.5 mg, after initial monthly therapy until maximum BCVA and no signs or no further improvement of disease activity, patients were monitored every month and retreated if any signs of disease activity occurred

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with Type 1 or Type 2 diabetes mellitus with glycosylated hemoglobin (HbA1c) ≤ 12.0%
- Patients with visual impairment due to DME in at least one eye
- BCVA ≥ 24 and ≤ 78 letters in the study eye
Exclusion Criteria:
- Active intraocular inflammation
- Any active infection in either eye at the
- Structural damage within 0.5 disc diameter of the center of the macula in the study eye
- Uncontrolled glaucoma in either eye at screening
Other protocol-defined inclusion/exclusion criteria may apply.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: a total of 135 patients were randomized and assigned in a 1:1 ratio to the treatment arms.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: At Screening, the eligibility criteria were performed.

baseline.population: Full analysis set (FAS). All patients randomized who received at least one application of study treatment and had at least one post-baseline assessment for the primary endpoint (BCVA).

outcome.title: Mean Average Change From Baseline in Best Corrected Visual Acuity (BCVA) of the Study Eye From Month 1 to Study Treatment Completion (Month 12)
outcome.description: BCVA was assessed as letters read using Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study (ETDRS) charts. The mean average change from baseline was defined as the difference between the average level of BCVA (ETDRS letters) over all post-baseline assessments from Month 1 to Month 12. A positive change represents an improvement in visual acuity

measure.title: Mean Average Change From Baseline in Best Corrected Visual Acuity (BCVA) of the Study Eye From Month 1 to Study Treatment Completion (Month 12)
measure.description: BCVA was assessed as letters read using Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study (ETDRS) charts. The mean average change from baseline was defined as the difference between the average level of BCVA (ETDRS letters) over all post-baseline assessments from Month 1 to Month 12. A positive change represents an improvement in visual acuity

class.title: post baseline average over month 1 to month 12

analysis.groups_desc: The primary objective was to demonstrate that the mean visit-averaged change from baseline of BCVA over month 1 to treatment completion for the DI arm was non-inferior to the PRN arm.
analysis.method_desc: including study treatment (DI, PRN) and center as factors and baseline BCVA as continuous covariate.

outcome.description: A treatment-free interval is the interval between the first NO treatment given when the reason for NO treatment given is one of the three stability criteria and the first subsequent YES treatment given after that.

reported_events.time_frame: From start of study treatment until month 12

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The terms and conditions of Novartis' agreements with its investigators may vary. However, Novartis does not prohibit any investigator from publishing. Any publications from a single-site are postponed until the publication of the pooled data (ie, data from all sites) in the clinical trial.
